natural problem: The sign function $\text{sgn}(x)$ is defined by \[\text{sgn}(x) = \left\{ \begin{aligned} -1 \quad &\text{if } x < 0 \\ 0 \quad &\text{if } x = 0 \\ 1 \quad &\text{if } x > 0. \end{aligned} \right. \]Compute $\sum_{n=-10}^{20} \text{sgn}(n).$
natural solution: The given sum equals \[\text{sgn}(-10) + \text{sgn}(-9) + \dots + \text{sgn}(-1) + \text{sgn}(0) + \text{sgn}(1) + \text{sgn}(2) + \dots + \text{sgn}(20),\]which comes out to $10(-1) + 1(0) + 20(1) = \boxed{10}.$

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes sgn :: "int \<Rightarrow> int"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. x < 0 \<longrightarrow> sgn x = -1"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. x = 0 \<longrightarrow> sgn x = 0"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. x > 0 \<longrightarrow> sgn x = 1"
shows  "(\<Sum> x = -10 .. 20. sgn x) = 10"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The sign function $\text{sgn}(x)$ is defined by \[\text{sgn}(x) = \left\{ \begin{aligned} -1 \quad &\text{if } x < 0 \\ 0 \quad &\text{if } x = 0 \\ 1 \quad &\text{if } x > 0. \end{aligned} \right. \]Compute $\sum_{n=-10}^{20} \text{sgn}(n).$ The final Answer is 10
 ### Proof
 The given sum equals \[\text{sgn}(-10) + \text{sgn}(-9) + \dots + \text{sgn}(-1) + \text{sgn}(0) + \text{sgn}(1) + \text{sgn}(2) + \dots + \text{sgn}(20),\]which comes out to $10(-1) + 1(0) + 20(1) = \boxed{10}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes sgn :: "int \<Rightarrow> int"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. x < 0 \<longrightarrow> sgn x = -1"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. x = 0 \<longrightarrow> sgn x = 0"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. x > 0 \<longrightarrow> sgn x = 1"
shows  "(\<Sum> x = -10 .. 20. sgn x) = 10"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Consider a function $sgn(x)$ defined as follows: $sgn(x) = -1$ for $x < 0$, $sgn(x) = 0$ for $x = 0$, and $sgn(x) = 1$ for $x > 0$. What is the sum of $sgn(x)$ for all integers $x$ from $-10$ to $20$? The final answer is $10$.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes sgn :: "int \<Rightarrow> int"
assumes h0 : "\<forall>n. n < 0 \<longrightarrow> sgn n = -1"
and h1 : "\<forall>n. n = 0 \<longrightarrow> sgn n = 0"
and h2 : "\<forall>n. n > 0 \<longrightarrow> sgn n = 1"
shows  "sum sgn {n. -10 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 20} = 10"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 The sign function $\text{sgn}(x)$ is defined by \[\text{sgn}(x) = \left\{ \begin{aligned} -1 \quad &\text{if } x < 0 \\ 0 \quad &\text{if } x = 0 \\ 1 \quad &\text{if } x > 0. \end{aligned} \right. \]Compute $\sum_{n=-10}^{20} \text{sgn}(n).$ The final Answer is 10
 ### Proof
 The given sum equals \[\text{sgn}(-10) + \text{sgn}(-9) + \dots + \text{sgn}(-1) + \text{sgn}(0) + \text{sgn}(1) + \text{sgn}(2) + \dots + \text{sgn}(20),\]which comes out to $10(-1) + 1(0) + 20(1) = \boxed{10}.$
 *)

and h1 : "\<forall>n. n = 0 \<longrightarrow> sgn n = 0"
and h2 : "\<forall>n. n > 0 \<longrightarrow> sgn n = 1"
shows  "sum sgn {n. -10 \<le> n \<and> n \<le> 20} = 10"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: For a function $sgn$, if $n$ is less than 0, $sgn(n) = -1$. If $n$ equals 0, $sgn(n) = 0$. If $n$ is greater than 0, $sgn(n) = 1$. What is the sum of $sgn(n)$ for all $n$ between -10 and 20 inclusive? The final answer is 10.
